alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 15 at 6:33PM MST until March 15 at 9:30PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues. * WHERE...A portion of west central Arizona, including the following county, Yavapai. * WHEN...Until 500 AM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Deadly flooding over low-water crossings. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 632 PM MST, rain and snowmelt is occurring, and will cause flooding. Between 0.75 and 1.25 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Willow Creek, Granite Creek, Butte Creek, Hassayampa River, Miller Creek and Bannon Creek. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.75 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Prescott, Downtown Prescott and White Spar Campground. - This includes the following highways... State Route 89 between mile markers 307 and 312...and between mile markers 314 and 316. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly or mountainous terrain, there are many low water crossings which will become dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
